summary: A documentary exploring historical and archeological anomalies challenging accepted timelines and scientific theories.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen, followed by a colorful, abstract animation featuring geometric shapes and the text "EVERYTHING INSIDE ME" (translated as "EVERYTHING INSIDE ME") in white letters. The animation transitions to a serene landscape with a road, trees, and mountains in the background. The text "SUBSCRIBE" appears in red, encouraging viewers to subscribe to the channel. The scene then displays the text "FOUND IN THE WRONG PLACE" in red, attributed to "Forbidden Science," suggesting a mysterious or intriguing theme. The video continues with the same landscape, now featuring a white house with a blue door and a stone wall. The text "Hi everyone!" appears at the bottom, followed by "I hope you are always healthy," conveying a friendly and welcoming message. Throughout the video, social media handles and a website link are displayed at the top, promoting the channel's online presence.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a deep, pulsing synth music that is rhythmic and suspenseful. This gives way to a male speaker who starts with a greeting, asking how the listeners are and expressing hope for their well-being. He welcomes the audience back to his channel. The music then fades in and out in the background, but remains an element present throughout.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a scenic view of a rural road flanked by lush greenery and a white house with a blue trash bin beside it. The text overlay reads, "Like always, today I'm going to discuss some topic that will make you wonder about the advanced technology of the past." The scene transitions to a similar view with the text, "I got this on a telegram channel called 'Forbidden Science.' https://t.me/taboo_science1," indicating the source of the content. The camera then pans along the road, revealing more of the countryside, with the text, "Some might say that I'm being 'repetitive' by discussing this," suggesting a recurring theme. The final frame shows the road stretching into the distance, with the text, "This is proof that a small occult elite have er-s-d and r-m-e the history to fit their narrative," hinting at a conspiracy theory about historical manipulation. Throughout the video, the serene rural setting remains consistent, with the road and house providing a tranquil backdrop to the thought-provoking text overlays.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing a topic related to advanced technology of the past, mentioning a Telegram channel called "Forbidden Science." He anticipates potential criticism of repetition, clarifying it is for demonstrating the manipulation of history by a small occult elite. The audio fades out.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scenic view of a rural road, bordered by lush greenery and stone walls, under a partly cloudy sky. The camera moves forward, capturing the tranquil countryside landscape. Text overlays appear, promoting a Telegram channel (t.me/everythinginsideme) and a backup YouTube channel, urging viewers to subscribe. The text also mentions that various information will be shared on the Telegram channel, which cannot be shared on the current platform. As the camera continues down the road, more text appears, emphasizing the importance of subscribing to the backup channel and providing a link in the description box. The video maintains a steady pace, showcasing the serene environment and the call to action for viewers to engage with the content creator's other platforms. The final frames display a large yellow number '1' and a Telegram link (https://t.me/taboo_science1), indicating the first channel or group for further information. The overall atmosphere is calm and inviting, encouraging viewers to explore additional content.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker promoting his Telegram channel and backup YouTube channel, promising exclusive information. He then humorously encourages listeners to "fasten your pants" and start. The clip transitions to a suspenseful, cinematic music piece, indicative of a documentary or dramatic setting. The piece features orchestral elements, contributing to a sense of mystery or anticipation. Finally, a male speaker utters "Pyramid in Bosnia," apparently, in line with the theme, ending the clip.

events_list.video_caption: The video features an aerial view from an airplane flying over a lush, green landscape with rolling hills and patches of farmland. The wing of the plane is visible in the foreground, and the scenery below is bathed in sunlight, creating a serene atmosphere. Throughout the video, text overlays appear at the bottom of the screen, providing commentary on the discovery of ancient pyramids in the center of Europe, similar to the Egyptian pyramids. The text suggests that this finding challenges the conventional history as recorded in textbooks. The social media handle "@insideimeiseverything" is displayed in the top right corner, indicating the source of the video. The video maintains a consistent visual theme, focusing on the aerial perspective and the accompanying text, which aims to provoke thought about historical narratives.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing a finding perceived as "fantastic," asserting it's ignored by "official science". He believes acknowledging pyramids in Europe would challenge established history. The speaker has a neutral tone with slight skepticism in his voice. At the end of the clip you hear a sound like coughing.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with an aerial view of a lush, green landscape, featuring a mountainous region with dense forests and cultivated fields. The camera, likely mounted on an aircraft, captures the scenery from a high altitude, showcasing the natural beauty of the area. Text overlays provide intriguing information about the geological features beneath the surface, mentioning a 1.5-meter layer of earth with trees and shrubs, and the presence of huge stone blocks tightly docked together. The narrative continues with additional text revealing that excavations at various points of the mountain uncovered a stone base beneath the soil layer. The video then highlights the mountain's sides, which are perfectly straight and form angles of 90 degrees, as seen in an aerial photograph. The scene transitions to a ground-level view, showing a dirt road winding through the countryside, bordered by trees and stone walls. The video concludes with a text overlay displaying a Telegram link (https://t.me/taboo_science1) and the number '2', suggesting a continuation or a new segment related to the topic. Throughout the video, the serene and picturesque environment is emphasized, with the camera capturing the natural beauty and unique geological features of the landscape.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a description of discoveries made within the 1.5-meter layer of earth, noting huge stone blocks and a stone base. This is delivered by a male speaker in an informative tone. Following this speech, a dark, atmospheric musical piece plays with dramatic synths and a foreboding tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a split-screen comparison of two bridges, one old and one new, set against a backdrop of lush greenery and a clear blue sky. The old bridge, with its intricate carvings and historical architecture, is juxtaposed with the modern bridge, featuring a sleek design and red railings. The text "Bridges then and bridges now" appears at the bottom, highlighting the contrast between the two eras. As the video progresses, the split-screen format continues, with the old bridge on the left and the new bridge on the right. The text changes to "And this is not the worst bridge yet. It is scary to live in a regressive world where you are assured that progress is being made," expressing a critical view of the current state of progress. The final frame maintains the split-screen format, with the text "It's scary to live with people who don't understand that," emphasizing the fear of living in a society that fails to grasp the significance of progress. Throughout the video, the environment remains consistent, with the old bridge set in a historical urban setting and the new bridge surrounded by a serene, natural landscape. The video effectively contrasts the old and new bridges, using text to convey a message about societal progress and understanding.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker reflecting on changes, noting "bridges then and bridges now," and expressing concern about living in a "regressive world." The tone is contemplative and slightly worried. The speech continues to describe how some people may fail to comprehend progress. Then, background music starts. It has an electronic style, potentially with synthesizers, which creates a somber or uneasy mood. The speaker goes silent while the music continues playing, dominating the audio landscape.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a serene countryside scene, featuring a dirt path leading through lush green fields and trees, with a prominent red-leaved tree in the distance. The sky is overcast, adding a tranquil atmosphere to the setting. Social media handles and a website URL are displayed at the top of the screen, indicating the video's source. A red 'SUBSCRIBE' button appears, encouraging viewers to follow the channel. The scene transitions to a darker, more ominous setting, with the landscape shrouded in mist or fog, creating a sense of mystery. The video then shifts to a road with a car driving away, and a countdown begins with the number '3' displayed prominently, along with a Telegram link (https://t.me/taboo_science1) in the center of the screen. The countdown suggests an upcoming reveal or significant event, maintaining the viewer's anticipation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker asking the listener to like and subscribe to the video if they learn something, emphasizing clicking the notification bell for updates and watching until the end. The speaker has a friendly and helpful tone, thanking the listener at the end of their request. Following the speech, there is a transition to instrumental music. The music sounds modern and electronic, maybe suitable for background ambience or transitions.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scenic view of a winding road surrounded by lush greenery and rolling hills, setting a tranquil rural atmosphere. Overlaying this serene backdrop is an illustration of a historical figure in ornate armor, holding a long firearm mounted on a tripod, accompanied by text explaining the ingredients needed to make gunpowder: saltpeter, sulfur, and coal. The narrative continues with the same illustration and text, emphasizing the historical context of sulfur availability at the mouth of the volcano Etna in Sicily. The scene transitions to a close-up of a rocky landscape, highlighting the geological features of Mount Karnasurt in the Polar region, known for its basalt slabs with perfectly even faces. The video then shifts to a detailed view of the rocky terrain, showcasing the natural formation of these slabs and their suitability for construction. The final frames present a pile of rocks and debris, with text suggesting that scientists believe this formation is natural. Throughout the video, the rural road and greenery remain a constant backdrop, providing a visual contrast to the historical and geological information being presented.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker talking about the three ingredients needed to make gunpowder, namely "saltpeter, sulfur, and coal", questioning how China could invent gunpowder. This is followed by a brief instrumental piece, which sounds like electronic music that creates a calm atmosphere. Afterward, the male speaker continues to talk about basalt slabs with even faces, their processing, and their potential as traces of ancient civilizations. The audio ends with him raising the question of whether these slabs are the work of humans.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scenic view of a rural landscape featuring a road, green fields, and distant hills under a partly cloudy sky. The text overlay introduces the painting "The Suicide of Saul," painted in 1562, and highlights three dinosaurs with riders in the center of the painting. The scene transitions to a close-up of a relief in the Khmer temple of Ta Prohm, near Angkor, depicting a stegosaurus. The relief, discovered by Europeans in the mid-19th century and restored 20 years ago, is shown in detail, emphasizing its cultural and historical significance. The video then returns to the painting, with text questioning how ancient animals like dinosaurs could appear in myths and legends, given the generally accepted scientific theory that dinosaurs became extinct tens of millions of years before humans appeared. The video concludes with a close-up of the stegosaurus relief, reinforcing the mystery and intrigue surrounding the depiction of dinosaurs in ancient art and legends.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male voice, offering an observation about a painting and claiming its depiction of dinosaurs implies 16th-century knowledge of them. The same speaker then points to a relief in a temple, asserting it displays a Stegosaurus, further theorizing that dragons in ancient legends are folkloric names for dinosaurs. Soft, somewhat melancholy background music accompanies the male speaker throughout.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a close-up of a corroded metal sarcophagus, partially buried in the ground, with a rural landscape in the background. Text overlays provide context, stating that the sarcophagus is from a Tang dynasty tomb in Taiyuan city and has not been opened until now due to concerns about oxidation. The camera then zooms out to reveal the sarcophagus in its entirety, with a red silk bow still wrapped around it, highlighting the contrast between the oxidized metal and the preserved silk. The video transitions to a scenic view of a bridge over a river, with text overlays directing viewers to a Telegram channel for more information. The video concludes with a serene landscape featuring a bridge and lush greenery, maintaining a calm and informative atmosphere throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a narrative, delivered by a single male speaker in a calm, informative tone, discussing the discovery of a golden sarcophagus from the Tang Dynasty in Taiyuan City, China. The narrator describes concerns about opening the sarcophagus due to fears of oxidation and mentions the surprising preservation of a silk ribbon. Transitioning smoothly, light, reflective background music begins to play, which suggests an uplifting, hopeful atmosphere.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a scenic view of a bridge over a river, surrounded by lush greenery and trees under a clear sky. The text overlay reads, "The Patom crater was long thought to be the result of the Tunguska explosion." The scene transitions to an aerial view of a crater in a forested area, with the text, "When scientists studied the trees growing on its slope, it turned out that they appeared before the meteorite impact." The narrative continues with the text, "but, instead, they witnessed... A nuclear explosion?" followed by, "Judging by the annual rings of trees, in 1845 in the crater area there was a fivefold increase in the radioactive isotope in the wood, which lasted for several decades." The video then shows the same aerial view of the crater with the text, "The same pattern is observed in the nuclear test area." The final scene shifts to a road with a train track running alongside it, with the text, "The reasons for the increased background radiation at a time when nuclear research was out of the question are still not clear." The video concludes with a large yellow number "8" and a URL, "https://t.me/taboo_science1," displayed on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker narrating about the Padom Crater and theories suggesting a nuclear explosion. His tone is informative and slightly mysterious as he details the scientific findings related to tree rings and radioactive isotopes. Subsequently, the audio transitions to music, a somber instrumental piece featuring a piano. There are no discernible background or ambient sounds present in this segment.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a scenic view of a countryside landscape featuring a railway track running through lush green fields and trees. The text at the bottom of the screen poses a question about the longevity of modern humans compared to their ancestors. The scene transitions to a close-up of a stone monument with inscriptions, including the years 1630-1930, indicating the lifespan of an individual. The text at the bottom provides context about the location in Bad Wildbad, Germany. The video then shifts to a serene landscape with rolling hills and a river, displaying a large number '9' and a Telegram link. Following this, an image of a blackened, humanoid figure is shown against the same countryside backdrop, with text explaining its discovery at a depth of about 100 meters, which contradicts archaeological expectations. The figure is described as not being considered a fake but also not investigated. The video concludes with the text 'Found in the wrong place and in the wrong place,' emphasizing the figure's anomalous discovery. Throughout the video, the social media handles '@insidemeiseverything' and 'bitchute.com/eim' are displayed at the top of the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a solemn, contemplative speech, seemingly reflecting on longevity and historical context. This is followed by a somber musical interlude featuring sustained, melancholic tones, creating a reflective mood. A male speaker then presents an account of an archaeological anomaly, describing the discovery of a human figure in an unexpected geological layer and the resulting lack of scientific investigation. The clip concludes with a curious invitation to reflect on the presented video.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a scenic view of a road winding through a lush, green landscape with rolling hills in the background. A white building with a blue door and a blue trash bin is situated on the right side of the road, surrounded by trees and a stone wall. The sky is overcast, adding a serene atmosphere to the scene. Text overlays appear throughout the video, starting with a request to like and share the video, followed by a message encouraging viewers to be aware of global events. The source of the information is credited to 'Forbidden Science' with a link provided. The video expresses gratitude to those who researched the topic and urges viewers to subscribe for upcoming videos. The final frames show a silver car driving past the building, and the video concludes with a black screen displaying the logo 'EIM' in the center.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with someone inviting viewers to like and share the video, emphasizing awareness of global events. Following this, there's an acknowledgment of those who contributed research and a call for subscription. The speaker expresses gratitude and hopes the information shared is beneficial. These spoken words transition to electronic music. The music has a calm vibe, with synthesized instrumentation and a repetitive beat.
